description: {"blocks":[{"key":"d398n","text":"This SOP defines a standardized method for processing, broadcasting, packaging and shipping  preparation of research quality non-islet biospecimens. These tissues may be matched or unmatched to the islet donor and are made available to approved investigators in the Integrated Islet Distribution Program (IIDP) sponsored by the National Institute of Diabetes and Digestive and Kidney Diseases (NIDDK) Institute.  This protocol is written to assist the participating islet isolation centers who are part of the IIDP. This protocol includes the order of the summarized processing of acinar tissue, however details can still be gleaned from the original Collection, Packaging and Cold Shipping of Fresh Non-Islet Pancreatic (Acinar) Tissue.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":651,"length":86},{"style":"bold","offset":736,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":651,"length":85}],"data":{}},{"key":"2buf2","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4h6lj","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5ptj3","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"a4mat","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9fokf","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"m5q3","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"900v8","text":"Note: The IIDP appreciates the professional input from Rita Bottino, PhD, Imagine Pharma; Dagmar Klein, PhD, University of Miami; and Peter Chlebeck, University of Wisconsin. Dr. Klein recommends the addition of protease inhibitors to the media for holding the acinar tissue until ready for shipment and in the shipping media. Recommendations from Dr. Bottino and Peter Chlebeck on the methods for the processing of blood products and ancillary tissues, included with the pancreas provided by the OPOs, for quality research samples for IIDP investigators has been invaluable to this protocol.  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":0,"length":594}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"41515C30410F11EEBADA7F4EDF40317C","url":"https://www.protocols.io/file-manager/433D531A7E474FC89F032C5F188521D3"}},"1":{"type":"notes","mutability":"","data":{"blocks":[{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"6rvnd","text":"Integrated Islet Distribution Program (IIDP) (RRID:SCR_014387)","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

guidelines: {"blocks":[{"key":"ac9d8","text":"Responsibilities:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":17}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"a6j8n","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"f4ld9","text":"It is the responsibility of the IIDP CC to both follow and ensure adherence to the procedures outlined in this SOP. In order to accomplish this, the IIDP CC will interact with the relevant personnel from each of the participating centers. ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"f0723","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"afg7j","text":"It is the responsibility of each IIDP center to follow the procedures listed in this SOP and to work to the best of their ability to follow all requirements.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"dco5r","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"errsr","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"7589k","text":"Definitions:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":12}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"4pcs1","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"dfbfh","text":"Integrated Islet Distribution Program (IIDP) (RRID:SCR_014387):The IIDP is a program commissioned and funded by the NIDDK to provide quality human islets to the diabetes research community to advance scientific discoveries and translational medicine. The IIDP consists of the NIDDK Project Scientist and Program Official, the External Evaluation Committee and the CC at City of Hope (COH). The IIDP CC integrates an interactive group of academic laboratories including the subcontracted IIDP centers.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"UNDERLINE","offset":0,"length":37},{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":37},{"style":"bold","offset":38,"length":25},{"style":"italic","offset":0,"length":37},{"style":"italic","offset":38,"length":25}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"aotpa","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"fpdah","text":"IIDP Coordinating Center (CC): Joyce Niland, Ph.D., IIDP Principal Investigator leads CC staff to coordinate the activities of the IIDP and assists the participating centers and investigators in the distribution of human islets.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"UNDERLINE","offset":0,"length":24},{"style":"italic","offset":0,"length":30},{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":30}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"4uiim","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"351kh","text":"Islet Equivalent (IEQ): An IEQ is defined as an islet with a diameter of 150 microns. The number of IEQ in each size class is calculated by multiplying the number of islets by a conversion factor for each micron size.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"UNDERLINE","offset":0,"length":17},{"style":"italic","offset":0,"length":24},{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":24}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"t2sk","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"dvvjj","text":"Approved Investigators: Researchers who have requested islets from the IIDP for basic science studies and whose research protocols have been reviewed and approved by the IIDP. ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"UNDERLINE","offset":0,"length":22},{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":22},{"style":"italic","offset":0,"length":22}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"3ladf","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"9v8hl","text":"Islet Allocation System (IA):  This is the online system administered by the IIDP to allow fair distribution of basic science islets to approved investigators. This interactive system, used by the IIDP Centers and the Approved Investigators, facilitates and tracks the distribution of human islets.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"UNDERLINE","offset":0,"length":23},{"style":"italic","offset":0,"length":31},{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":31}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"f21ln","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"apt7j","text":"Non-Islet Pancreatic (Acinar) Tissue (NIPT): During a standard human islet isolation, the digested tissue goes through a purification process that allows the majority of the isolated islets to be separated from the acinar and other pancreatic tissues. This is commonly done using density gradients and a COBE centrifugation processor. The lighter density tissues, including the majority of human islets, are collected from the lighter density gradients, leaving the remaining pancreatic tissue, in the COBE processor bag that still holds the denser gradients and tissue. This non-islet pancreatic tissue is commonly referred to as the “acinar” tissue, although in reality, it contains not only the acinar tissue but also connective tissue, blood vessel fragments, ductal fragments as well as imbedded islets.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"UNDERLINE","offset":0,"length":37},{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":45},{"style":"italic","offset":0,"length":45}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Collection of Acinar/Non-Islet Pancreatic (Acinar) Tissue (NIPT): for Distribution (Fresh and Frozen)
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"1dog1","text":"The NIPT (the tissue remaining in the COBE purification bag) should be transferred under sterile conditions, into two 250 mL conical tubes, as soon as feasible during the islet isolation process. Top with HBSS, cap, invert to mix and dilute Ficoll, and centrifuge at   .","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":267,"length":1}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"centrifuge","mutability":"","data":{"centrifuge":"180","duration":120,"guid":"8ACA3960ECA111EA95E9FF9A14F10B53","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null,"temperature":"4","temperatureUnit":10,"unit":34}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"ecn4g","text":"Check broadcast records for the number of researchers and the amounts of acinar cells that were requested.                                                                                                                                                                                                • If no acinar tissue is requested, tissue may be disposed of in biohazard waste.","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":300,"length":79}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"cm0nk","text":"Calculate the amount of PIM(T)® Complete needed.  Complete that which is needed for all shipments.  Add 1 mL of Trypsin inhibitor stock  to each 100 mL of PIM(T)® Complete for NIPT shipping (~150 mL of media/1 mL NIPT total requested). This will give a final working concentration of 100 μg/mL of Trypsin inhibitor in the media. Resuspend only the amount of NIPT needed to complete the requests in 10x the volume of PIM(T)® Complete plus inhibitor.  Example: If there is one request for 3 mL and two for 1.5 mL, only resuspend 6 mL of NIPT in 60 mL of  PIM(T)® Complete plus inhibitor. This will save on the cost of the inhibitor and media.","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":450,"length":190},{"style":"bold","offset":553,"length":16},{"style":"bold","offset":570,"length":14}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ca95k","text":"Label required  bottles with requesting researchers' names, RRID# of acinar tissue, and date. steps.section: Preparation and Packaging of Frozen Acinar/Non-Islet Pancreatic (Acinar) Tissue (NIPT):
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"cd8bf","text":"As investigator’s requests are determined through the broadcast system for Flash Frozen Acinar/Non-Islet Pancreatic (Acinar) Tissue (NIPT), prepare appropriate amounts of tissue into proper sized consolidation vessels for freezing from the diluted samples in Collection of Acinar-NIPT for Distribution (Fresh and Frozen) Step 13.4    above. Label each conical for identification during transfer. Label corresponding 5mL cryogenic tube (cryotube) with acinar RRID #, date, amount of requested NIPT tissue and recipient name and hold until ready for final transfer.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":75,"length":63},{"style":"bold","offset":259,"length":61},{"style":"bold","offset":321,"length":12},{"style":"italic","offset":75,"length":63},{"style":"italic","offset":259,"length":61},{"style":"italic","offset":321,"length":12},{"style":"UNDERLINE","offset":95,"length":37}],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":332,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"6lrb3","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8ddfv","text":"For 0.5 – 1.0 mL of requested NIPT pelleted tissue, add 5 - steps.section: NIB Broadcast Deadline / Processing and Preparation for Shipment
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"8df35","text":"The NIB broadcast deadline should coincide with the end of the purification process, allowing the center to determine the requested need for acinar tissue in order to remove and wash only the tissue needed for distribution. The acinar harvest and packaging can be followed in Step 13 below. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":141,"length":6},{"style":"bold","offset":228,"length":6},{"style":"bold","offset":276,"length":7}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6f3om","text":" Following NIB broadcast deadline, determine the specific tissues requested and amounts and process NIB as soon as possible to preserve quality for interested investigators.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":92,"length":80},{"style":"bold","offset":92,"length":81}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"12atu","text":"Check the results of the NIB Broadcast and determine which, how much, or how many samples of the offered tissue have been requested.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ecc2l","text":"If there are no requests for specific NIBs, the specific tissue can be discarded in biohazard waste.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":0,"length":100},{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":100}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6os08","text":"Label appropriate tissue containers with researcher's name, #RRID of the specific tissue, and the date of the isolation.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1ahpm","text":"Specific packaging instructions for cold tissues can be found in Step 15 of this document or in Packaging and Cold Shipping of Human Islets SOP, Step 3 Packaging Islets. ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":65,"length":8},{"style":"bold","offset":96,"length":72},{"style":"italic","offset":96,"length":73}],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":96,"length":72}],"data":{}},{"key":"5k54a","text":"Centers can choose the order of biospecimen fulfillment to investigators, however acinar tissue should be processed the same day as the isolation, and shipped at the next FedEx Pick up time due to risk of autodigestion.  ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":220,"length":1},{"style":"italic","offset":220,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"d3r1h","text":"Fresh biospecimens should be shipped the day of, or the day following, the islet isolation.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6up2o","text":"All biospecimens should be divided and handled under a laminar flow hood using sterile technique.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fgjj1","text":"Cold samples can be combined into a single package if more than one sample is requested for a single researcher.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"31ttm","text":"Frozen samples can be combined into a single package if more than one sample is requested for a single researcher.  ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5q9v0","text":"If islets are requested and will be shipped the following day, all but fresh acinar tissues samples, can be held and shipped with the islets if approved by the researcher. (Fresh acinar should be sent on the day of isolation or with the next FedEx pick up time due to the danger of autodigestion.)","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6be4r","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"em264","text":"♦ Note: The health and handling of the islet preparation should always take the priority in the IIDP distribution process. However, the NIB tissue is also important to the recipients and the acinar tissue, because of it's capacity to secrete harmful enzymes, should be kept diluted and cold at all times.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":1,"length":6},{"style":"italic","offset":8,"length":296},{"style":"bold","offset":6,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"FDCBFB10E92411EDA7CD0A58A9FEAC02","url":"https://www.protocols.io/view/packaging-and-cold-shipping-of-human-islets-ewov18o7ogr2/v2"}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"300sv","text":"Surround bottle(s) with six   cold packs, one on bottom, one on each of the four sides and one on top.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":28,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"7p8b4","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"","data":{"guid":"99AC77A6EE9E11EDB5AE0A58A9FEAC02","id":0,"label":"","temperature":"8","unit":10}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"el8rh","text":"Place one   CryoPak pouch and one   frozen ice pack (stored in the freezer) in the bottom of the Styrofoam box.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":10,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":34,"length":1}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"","data":{"guid":"C4F1A53FEE9E11EDB5AE0A58A9FEAC02","id":0,"label":"","temperature":"8","unit":10}},"1":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"","data":{"guid":"C4F1A585EE9E11EDB5AE0A58A9FEAC02","id":0,"label":"","temperature":"-20","unit":10}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"frvdr","text":"Place the inner cardboard box containing the NIPT on top of the pouch and pack, ensuring that the bottle inside as well as the inner cardboard box, is lying on its side to ensure the maximum surface area for the acinar tissue to settle and centered in the shipping container. ♦ Note: The inner box and bottle are opposite of the way islet tissue is shipped.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":275,"length":82},{"style":"italic","offset":278,"length":79}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"depm5","text":"The shipping center will enter the NIPT to be shipped (Confirm Recipient screen) and will enter FedEx tracking numbers Broadcast System. In addition, the shipping center should process the shipment by using the on-line FedEx process and click the prompt to alert the recipient of the FedEx tracking number. This will help the recipient investigator follow their shipment through the FedEx system and free up time for the centers and the IIDP.  The investigators will have the FedEx tracking numbers listed in their History of Acinar Tissue Offers table.
